definition: pedestrian/traveler on foot/passer-by/official responsible for arranging audiences with the emperor
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
person who has failed to fulfill a court order

sentences.english: If the car does not yield to pedestrian, the car could be ticketed.
sentences.chinese: 大多數國家，如果車子不給行人讓路，會被抄罰單的。

sentences.english: The Distributor is authorized to sub-contract and assign the distribution and sales of the Products to sub-contractors of Fangyuan Group.
sentences.chinese: 發行人已授權轉包及銷售此產品給方園集團的轉包商。

sentences.english: He was in such a hurry to get out that he barged into a passer-by.
sentences.chinese: 他急急忙忙地往外走，竟與一位行人撞了個滿懷。

sentences.english: I shouted to the pedestrians for help, but no one stopped.
sentences.chinese: 我大喊着向行人道上的路人求助，但是沒有人停下來。

sentences.english: We sat down on the park bench and watched the people as they passed.
sentences.chinese: 我們坐在公園的長凳上，把穩考察着來往的行人。

sentences.english: In the language of the layman the epicrustal rocks can best be described as the "scum" .
sentences.chinese: 用外行人的話來說，淺成巖最好稱爲“浮渣”。

sentences.english: The publisher of the book went further though.
sentences.chinese: 然而，此書的發行人做得更絕。

sentences.english: Pedestrians were splashed to the HIP in muddy slush.
sentences.chinese: 行人走在泥漿中，下半身全濺上了污泥。

sentences.english: Domestic issuers are not subject to this requirement.
sentences.chinese: 此爲本國發行人所無之規定。

sentences.english: Li gave several more songs to cry, to go after the Spring Green pedestrians.
sentences.chinese: 一聲驪歌幾聲哭，行人去後春江綠。
一定要使用行人穿越道。

sentences.english: One can no longer walk the streets without seeing beggars importuning passers by.
sentences.chinese: 走在街上總能看到乞丐糾纏行人乞討。

sentences.english: The GLK-Class also heralds further improvements in pedestrian protection.
sentences.chinese: 該glk級，也預示着進一步改善，在行人保護。

sentences.english: Pedestrians in deep sorrow on the road.
This is a very busy road, with approximately 8 lanes for a pedestrian to cross.
sentences.chinese: 該道路十分繁忙，行人過馬路須穿越八個車道的道路。

sentences.english: Risks that have seen a decline in importance are the ones that first come to mind for the layman.
sentences.chinese: 外行人首先會考慮風險重要性的降低程度。

definition: mixed use (e.g. pedestrians and vehicles)/joint operation (e.g. trains and buses)
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
